description: a(n) = least m such that if r and s in {|F(h+1)-tau*F(h)|: h = 1,2,...,n} satisfy r < s, then r < k/m < s for some integer k, where F = A000045 (Fibonacci numbers) and tau = (1+sqrt(5))/2 (golden ratio).
comments: For a guide to related sequences, see A001000. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 12 2012
mathematica: f[n_] := Fibonacci[n]; r = GoldenRatio;leastSeparator[seq_] := Module[{n = 1},Table[While[Or @@ (Ceiling[n #1[[1]]] <2 + Floor[n #1[[2]]] &) /@ (Sort[#1, Greater] &) /@Partition[Take[seq, k], 2, 1], n++]; n, {k, 2, Length[seq]}]];t = Flatten[Table[Abs[f[h + 1] - r*f[h]], {h, 1, 21}]];leastSeparator[t](* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Aug 01 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
